verbs.description: [ARG0: Reporters] [V: asked] [ARG2: Ted Cruz] [ARG1: if Donald Trump is right about having an " absolute right " to pardon himself] . It did n't go especially well .
Reporters asked Ted Cruz if [ARG1: Donald Trump] [V: is] [ARG2: right about having an " absolute right " to pardon himself] . It did n't go especially well .
Reporters asked Ted Cruz if Donald Trump is right about [V: having] [ARG1: an " absolute right " to pardon himself] . It did n't go especially well .
Reporters asked Ted Cruz if Donald Trump is right about having an " absolute right " to [V: pardon] [ARG1: himself] . It did n't go especially well .
Reporters asked Ted Cruz if Donald Trump is right about having an " absolute right " to pardon himself . It [V: did] n't go especially well .
Reporters asked Ted Cruz if Donald Trump is right about having an " absolute right " to pardon himself . [ARG1: It] did [ARGM-NEG: n't] [V: go] [ARGM-MNR: especially well] .
